comment:
* A {@link SmartspaceTarget} is a data class which holds all properties necessary to inflate a * smartspace card. It contains data and related metadata which is supposed to be utilized by * smartspace clients based on their own UI/UX requirements. Some of the properties have * {@link SmartspaceAction} as their type because they can have associated actions. * *

NOTE: * If either {@link mRemoteViews} or {@link mWidget} is set, it should be preferred over all * other properties. (An exception is thrown if both are set.) * Else, if {@link mSliceUri} is set, it should be preferred over all other data properties. * Otherwise, the instance should be treated as a data object. * * @hide

variables.name: mSmartspaceTargetId
variables.comment: A unique Id for an instance of {@link SmartspaceTarget}.

variables.name: mHeaderAction
variables.comment: A {@link SmartspaceAction} for the header in the Smartspace card.

variables.name: mBaseAction
variables.comment: A {@link SmartspaceAction} for the base action in the Smartspace card.

variables.name: mCreationTimeMillis
variables.comment: A timestamp indicating when the card was created.

variables.name: mExpiryTimeMillis
variables.comment:
* A timestamp indicating when the card should be removed from view, in case the service
     * disconnects or restarts.

variables.name: mScore
variables.comment: A score assigned to a target.

variables.name: mActionChips
variables.comment: A {@link List<SmartspaceAction>} containing all action chips.

variables.name: mIconGrid
variables.comment: A {@link List<SmartspaceAction>} containing all icons for the grid.

variables.name: mFeatureType
variables.comment:
* {@link FeatureType} indicating the feature type of this card.
     *
     * @see FeatureType

variables.name: mSensitive
variables.comment:
* Indicates whether the content is sensitive. Certain UI surfaces may choose to skip rendering
     * real content until the device is unlocked.

variables.name: mShouldShowExpanded
variables.comment: Indicating if the UI should show this target in its expanded state.

variables.name: mSourceNotificationKey
variables.comment: A Notification key if the target was generated using a notification.

variables.name: mComponentName
variables.comment: {@link ComponentName} for this target.

variables.name: mUserHandle
variables.comment: {@link UserHandle} for this target.

variables.name: mAssociatedSmartspaceTargetId
variables.comment:
* Target Id of other {@link SmartspaceTarget}s if it is associated with this target. This
     * association is added to tell the UI that a card would be more useful if displayed with the
     * associated smartspace target. This field is supposed to be taken as a suggestion and the
     * association can be ignored based on the situation in the UI. It is possible to have a one way
     * card association. In other words, Card B can be associated with Card A but not the other way
     * around.

variables.name: mSliceUri
variables.comment: {@link Uri} Slice Uri if this target is a slice.

variables.name: mWidget
variables.comment: {@link AppWidgetProviderInfo} if this target is a widget.

variables.name: FEATURE_STEP_DATE
variables.comment: This represents a DATE. "STEP" is a typo.

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_DEFAULT
variables.comment: template is also a base card for the other types of templates.

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_SUB_IMAGE
variables.comment: Sub-image template whose data is represented by {@link SubImageTemplateData}

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_SUB_LIST
variables.comment: Sub-list template whose data is represented by {@link SubListTemplateData}

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_CAROUSEL
variables.comment: Carousel template whose data is represented by {@link CarouselTemplateData}

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_HEAD_TO_HEAD
variables.comment: Head-to-head template whose data is represented by {@link HeadToHeadTemplateData}

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_COMBINED_CARDS
variables.comment: Combined-cards template whose data is represented by {@link CombinedCardsTemplateData}

variables.name: UI_TEMPLATE_SUB_CARD
variables.comment: Sub-card template whose data is represented by {@link SubCardTemplateData}

variables.name: CREATOR
variables.comment: * @see Parcelable.Creator

methods.name: public String getSmartspaceTargetId()
methods.comment: * Returns the Id of the target.

methods.name: public SmartspaceAction getHeaderAction()
methods.comment: * Returns the header action of the target.

methods.name: public SmartspaceAction getBaseAction()
methods.comment: * Returns the base action of the target.

methods.name: public long getCreationTimeMillis()
methods.comment: * Returns the creation time of the target.

methods.name: public long getExpiryTimeMillis()
methods.comment: * Returns the expiry time of the target.

methods.name: public float getScore()
methods.comment: * Returns the score of the target.

methods.name: public List<SmartspaceAction> getActionChips()
methods.comment: * Return the action chips of the target.

methods.name: public List<SmartspaceAction> getIconGrid()
methods.comment: * Return the icons of the target.

methods.name: public int getFeatureType()
methods.comment: * Returns the feature type of the target.

methods.name: public boolean isSensitive()
methods.comment: * Returns whether the target is sensitive or not.

methods.name: public boolean shouldShowExpanded()
methods.comment: * Returns whether the target should be shown in expanded state.

methods.name: public String getSourceNotificationKey()
methods.comment: * Returns the source notification key of the target.

methods.name: public ComponentName getComponentName()
methods.comment: * Returns the component name of the target.

methods.name: public UserHandle getUserHandle()
methods.comment: * Returns the user handle of the target.

methods.name: public String getAssociatedSmartspaceTargetId()
methods.comment: * Returns the id of a target associated with this instance.

methods.name: public Uri getSliceUri()
methods.comment: * Returns the slice uri, if the target is a slice.

methods.name: public AppWidgetProviderInfo getWidget()
methods.comment: * Returns the AppWidgetProviderInfo, if the target is a widget.

methods.name: public RemoteViews getRemoteViews()
methods.comment: * Returns the {@link RemoteViews} to show over the target.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
